figgy.title: Viewer for groups of objects linked to a single finding aid component

comments.body: @tpendragon Yes, I agree that's the best way to handle the Ground and Buildings records, and having the child volumes means that if we want to go back and migrate more of the MODS metadata, we have ScannedResources to attach them. I'm closing this ticket since the current functionality works fine for the immediate use case and we can open new tickets for other use cases that pop up.

figgy.title: Can we get the label text under the image to wrap in order manager?

comments.body: @kelea99 can you explain more? The title mentions order manager but the screen shot shows the viewer. Which text and which image? What am I supposed to see when I follow the link?

@hackmastera Of course! When one changes the label for an image, it done in order manager. I  (perhaps wrongly)assumed that if we were wanting to have the text wrapped, it would be within order manager's functionality? but you are correct, it also does not wrap in the viewer (the lovely folks in conservation made this mockup illustrating generally what they were thinking about, but would be happy to see the text wrapping).

comments.body: Looks fantastic!
"Claim from Raphael" is a button that allows you to claim an object that's been claimed by another person?

@hackmastera that is what I gathered from this option. It can be useful if folks would like to take something due to language or subject knowledge, or if something was claimed by an individual no longer working in the project, etc..

@hackmastera Yeah, I'm trying to figure out the test.

I put it on the top because A) The bottom bar felt mostly navigational, B) The bottom bar's full for most resource types, and C) There's a bunch of partials that make up the bottom bar, this was easier.
@hackmastera Should be ready for re-review.

> I put it on the top because A) The bottom bar felt mostly navigational, B) The bottom bar's full for most resource types, and C) There's a bunch of partials that make up the bottom bar, this was easier.

Yeah. I'm concerned we really need some more UI attention here (for buttons / navigation / actions in general). But obviously the need for the feature is urgent so this PR shouldn't be blocked.

princeton_ansible.title: [lib-www, recap, pas] Ship remote client information to Apache for library server
Archivespace role is pointing at a bad percona cluster name
[Percona] Update the values for wait_timeout max_allowed_packet #610

comments.body:
```
pulsys@library-staging1:/tmp/wrk$ wrk -t12 -c800 -d60s "http://localhost/research/databases"
Running 1m test @ http://localhost/research/databases
  12 threads and 800 connections
  Thread Stats   Avg      Stdev     Max   +/- Stdev
    Latency   614.80ms  162.36ms   1.98s    74.58%
    Req/Sec    61.72     45.71   343.00     61.19%
  14504 requests in 1.00m, 1.99GB read
  Socket errors: connect 0, read 0, write 0, timeout 63
Requests/sec:    241.44
Transfer/sec:     33.86MB
```

We tried changing the options above, but that did not solve the issue.
Found that if we point the database directly to maria-staging1 the errors stopped.  We ran above to verify that the 500 errors stopped.

We need to update the library website, special collections, and any other place we used `mariadb-staging` to be `mariadb-staging1` and `mariadb-prod` to be `mariadb-prod1`

pulfalight.title: Draft interactive wireframes for each screen featured on PULFALight

comments.body:
@faithc and @apferrar it took me a while to find an example in the ArchivesSpace PUI, but [it looks like they finished the Expanded View](http://sandbox.archivesspace.org/public/repositories/3/resources/3/collection_organization) (aka, SPV). 

It looks similar to how I think we want ours to look, I intend to borrow from this in the Expanded View wireframe. I also like how the TOC follows you as you navigate. One thing to note: Unittitles are hidden from view and don't wrap, however one can drag the edge of the TOC to reveal longer names and to make it wider/narrower.
Latest wireframes: https://xd.adobe.com/view/3660a78e-6fda-4eaf-7db5-09e9e7700340-4051/

Just some quick, initial thoughts. 

I actually find the ASpace PUI a bit clunky, fidgety (? I can't think of a good word, haha), and a little confusing in terms of having to use both scroll bars to navigate up and down the page and the ToC, particularly navigating to the top and "bottom" (since it continues to expand) of the page, and expanding the width of the ToC. There's a lot going on. 

Overall, the latest wireframes look great. Still think the ToC is a bit too large. I like the size of the ToC in the ASpace expanded view with the shortened titles. Perhaps some of the white space following the titles (re: the wireframes) could be removed, though not sure whether the space is to accommodate the longest title/text string.
